member.name: M:McKnight.Similization.Client.WindowsForms.WindowsClientApplication.GetControl(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets an ISimilizationControl that is of the specified type.
member.param: A System.Type that refers to the type of interface that the control should implement.
member.returns: A reference to an Windows Forms control that implements the specified interface
member.remarks: This method controls the mapping between the generic form and dialog interfaces declared in the Similization Client and the concrete windows forms classes that implement those interfaces. This method is an override of the same function in the more generic Similization Client, so this method is mostly called from code in the SimilizationClient.dll assembly.

member.name: P:McKnight.Similization.Client.WindowsForms.GameWindow.GoToCursor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the game control is in "go to" mode. When in this mode, the active unit will go to the grid cell selected on the map. When moving the cursor around the screen, the map will show the path the unit will take and the number of turns it will take to reach the destination.

member.summary: Gets or sets the coordinates to draw in the center of the view.

member.name: E:McKnight.Similization.Client.WindowsForms.GridViewBase.CenterCellChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the CenterCell property changes.
member.remarks:
The CenterCell property can change for many different reasons, including:
The user scrolls the map
The user clicks a cell in the map
The user selectes a different area in the MiniMap
The game changes the focused cell (i.e. to bring attention to something in the game).

member.name: M:McKnight.Similization.Client.WindowsForms.GridViewBase.OnCenterCellChanged
member.summary: Fires the CenterCellChanged event.
